alert.note: Alert for Boulder (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 10:19PM MDT until July 28 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Boulder. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1019 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Boulder Creek, South Boulder Creek, Dry Creek, Bear Canyon Creek, Coal Creek, Rock Creek and Walnut Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Boulder, western Broomfield, Lafayette, Louisville, Superior, Eldorado Springs and Marshall.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
